A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I left the theater less than satisfied by this film. It had several moments that seemed to point to what I was hoping to see from this self-proclaimed (or perhaps critic acclaimed) greatest segment of the Star Wars franchise. 

Visually the effects were pretty decent\, but the scene inside the "throne room" was very reminiscent of a 1950's low budget film. the red backdrop set a very peculiar look and feel to the scene that in my opinion failed to achieve the desired goal. instead of majestic it came off as cheesy.

Mark Hamill seemed as though he may have had a great time making the movie and I looked at him in a fresh light from this performance. Carrie Fisher looked tired\, and I may have been influenced knowing she died not long after her filming her parts.

Overall I feel the movie tried to incorporate too many of the old elements of the saga and  was either afraid to stray too far from the tired and true formula or they have run out of ideas. Or perhaps we have just come to expect an impossible level of entertainment that any future installments into the Star Wars universe will be unable to achieve.

Either way it was ok\, especially compared to most of the films out there in theaters currently\, but nowhere near a great movie.
